item.title: Lili Karashchuk
item.description: The most useful thing I've done when writing up a paper is to have a text file that tells me how to generate each plot. It can be as simple as pointing to specific file or function to generate a figure.In the writing and review process, there are large gaps where I don't do much with the paper and then have to regenerate figures again. It's so much easier with these starting points! #academia

item.title: Berna Devezer
item.description: One key point we make is that we should stop equating scientific discovery to statistical inference(s) made in a given paper and expecting each paper to produce a fact-like discovery, and start reconceptualizing discovery as a potential outcome of a long process of exploration. Discoveries do not live in papers, they exist at the community-/system-level. We are not promised a discovery just because we hope to make one.

item.title: Daniel Lakens
